result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan A Eckstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply 9 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF1335.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No VIOLENT contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Case 15CM1110 is dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ryan A Eckstrom in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Victim presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
9 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Concurrent to:  15CF1335
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by the agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No VIOLENT contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.


Costs:  $243
